bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Petition for Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and Sisiter Superior M. Angelique, for a Writ of Certiorari.} No.1078 Petition for Appeal
In the matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fecre, Georgette normand and Marie Le Fecre for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Circuit Court.

Come now the above named petitioners, James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique by Edward E. Cushman, Asssitant United States Attorney, and deeming themselves aggreved by the orders and judgements made and filed in the above entitled cause on the 19th day of Februrary, 1903 and the 4th 5th day of March, 1903, hereby appeal from said orders and the findings, conclusions and judgements to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit, for the reason specified int he assignment of errors filed herewith Petitioners respectfully pray that on account thereof its appeal be allowed, and writ of error issued to correct the errors complained of and to reverse and annul the said orders, findings, conclusions and judgements against petitioners.

Your petitioners further show that all their acts herein which are involved in this case and suit were performed by and the authority of the Secretary of the Tresury of the United States and as Goverment officers and under the authority of the oficers of the Treasury Department.
Wherefore, your petitioners pray that their appeal may be allowed without bond.

Petitioners furher show, that they have this day filed herewith their assignment of errors committed by the court in this cause and intended to be urged by your petitioners as appellants in tthe prosecution of this suit upon appeal. Dated this 5th day of march, 1903.
Edward E Cushman Assistant United States Attorney.

The foregoing petition upon appeal and prayer for writ of eror is hereby granted and the claim of appeal therein made is allowed, and good cause being shown therfore, it is further ordered, that said appeal being on behalf of the officers of the United States Goverment and taken up to the United States & of the Department of Justice the Territory be allowed withought bond, and to the end that the applicats for writ of habeas corpus may be held to aswer the final judgment of appeal; and that the petitioners herein may not be in contempt of this court, and for other good and sufficient reasons, it is ordered that the orders and judgements herein appealed from are hereby stayed pending the final detemination of said appeal.
In the Circuit Court of the United States In District of Washington

James P. Levin Suit
Appeallents vs Yvonne Le Fevre et al Respondents Petition for Appeal & order allowing
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON MAR 5 1903 A.REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd Dep.
